SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

curam.util.webservices
Class StubFactory

java.lang.Object
  curam.util.webservices.StubFactory

public final class StubFactory
extends java.lang.Object

This class must be used to make outbound web services calls. It implements this process in a manner that does not have adverse effects on the performance and scalability of the application. Calls are also instrumented for the gathering of runtime statistics using the JMX infrastructure. It is recommended to use the getPooledStub methods which return pooled client stubs.

Use this class in the following manner: 

 PooledStub<MyStub> stub = null;
 try {
   stub = StubFactory.getPooledStub(MyStub.class);
   stub.getStub().myMethod();
 } finally {
   if (stub != null) {
     stub.returnToPool();
   }
 }

Note: In order to benefit from the JMX instrumentation of the outgoing web service calls you need to ensure that you invoke the generated stub methods rather than use the stub's ServiceClient instance to invoke the remote web service. Following on the previous example notice how 

 stub.getStub().myMethod()
was invoked as opposed to using the ServiceClient attached to the stub: 
 stub.getStub()._getServiceClient().sendReceive(...)

The following application properties control the behaviour of the returned stubs and the pool of stubs:

  • curam.ws.client_stub_pool_size_per_endpoint - The number of cached client stubs per web service end point (IP-address:port:web-service). The value of this property must be <= curam.ws.client_max_host_connections. The default value is 10.
  • curam.ws.client_stub_pool_idle_time - The amount of time in milliseconds that a pool entry can sit idle for before being eligible for eviction. The default value is 300,000 (5 minutes).
  • curam.ws.client_stub_pool_eviction_run_interval - The amount of time in milliseconds between runs of evictions checks. The default value is 60,000 (1 minute).
  • curam.ws.client_max_total_connections - The number of allowed total outbound connections to web service end points. The value of this property must be >= curam.ws.client_max_host_connections. The default value is 100.
  • curam.ws.client_max_host_connections - The number of allowed number of connection to one host end point (IP-address:port). The value of this property must be >= curam.ws.client_stub_pool_size_per_endpoint and <= curam.ws.client_max_total_connections. The default value is 50.
  • curam.ws.client_connection_timeout - The amount of time, in milliseconds, that a client stub waits for a connection to a web service end point. The default value is 60,000 (1 minute).
  • curam.ws.client_socket_timeout - The amount of time, in milliseconds, that a socket operation waits before throwing a timeout error. The default value is 60,000 (1 minute).
  • curam.jmx.ws_outbound_statistics_enabled - The application property that specifies whether or not the JMX statistics for outbound web services calls are enabled.

static class StubFactory.PooledStub<T extends org.apache.axis2.client.Stub>
          This class manages a client stub while it's borrowed from the pool.

Use this method to create a new client stub for the specified web service; note that the returned object must only be used by a single thread at a time.

Type Parameters:
T - the class of the stub
Parameters:
stub - the class of the generated client stub
ctxt - the configuration context to use for this stub; if null the default configuration context will be used. Note that the ConfigurationContext class in Axis2 is thread safe and should be shared amongst as many stubs as possible.
Returns:
the created client stub

getPooledStub

public static <T extends org.apache.axis2.client.Stub> StubFactory.PooledStub<T> getPooledStub(java.lang.Class<T> stubClass)
                                                                                    throws java.lang.Exception
Invoke this method to obtain a pooled client stub for the specified web service. Ensure a call to StubFactory.PooledStub.returnToPool() is made on the returned object once the stub is no longer needed. Using a pooled client stub ensures efficient use of resources when making web service invocations and it is the recommended way to obtain a reference to a client stub. The return object must only be used in the same thread that made the invocation to this method.

Type Parameters:
T - the class of the stub
Parameters:
stubClass - the class of the generated client stub
Returns:
a StubFactory.PooledStub object
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - when an error occurs

                                                                                    throws java.lang.Exception

The return object must only be used in the same thread that made the invocation to this method.
